description.narrative:
ASCE-LC has applied to Sida for funding of 13 million SEK to carry out the "organisational strengthening project for the high state control and anti-corruption authority of Burkina Faso" in Burkina Faso during the period 2017-2019. The intervention aims at strengthening ASCE-LC's capacities to implement efficiently its mission by 1)facilitating the controllers' mission with strategic and operational documents, 2)the introduction of modern human resources management tools and the improvement of the work conditions to boost the staff motivation; 3)the surveyors and verification assistants master the technics of denunciations reception, survey and report drafting; 4)the state controllers master the internal performance audit technics and the thorough analysis of the financial states of state societies; 5)review the best practices at the peer organisations level; 6)improving the public service of the managers and the senior officers to the users; 7)mastering computerized tools to reinforce ASCE-LC's credibility; 8)increasing the population awareness on corruption issues and agree with the prevention messages; 9)increasing the population ownership of the information and their participation to the actions against corruption; 10)increasing the commitment of the peer partners to the coordination of the fight against corruption; 11)increase citizen reporting of corruption cases to ASCE-LC, and 12)increasing the commitment to fight corruption at all levels. The ASCE-LC will implement the intervention together with CSOs, the general inspection of finances (IGF) and the cour des comptes.
The intervention’s total budget is 13 000 000 millions SEK contributed by Sida.

Den högsta statliga tillsynsmyndigheten för kontroll och anti-korruption, ASCE-LC, har ansökt hos Sida om finansiering med 13 miljoner kronor för genomförande av det organisatoriska kapacitetsstärkande projektet av kontrollmyndigheten i Burkina Faso under perioden 2017-2019.
Insatsen syftar till att förstärka myndighetens allmänna kapacitet för att kontrollera statsförvaltningen och hantera korruptionen i landet genom 1) formulering av strategier 2) personalförstärkning och 3) stärkande av information för att minska korruptionen och förbättra förvaltningen. ASCE-LC kommer att genomföra insatsen tillsammans med det civila samhällets organisationer och Finansinspektionen (Inspection Generale des Finances, IGF) samt Förvaltningsdomstolen (Cours des Comptes).
Insatsens totala budget är 13 000 000 kronor.

description.narrative: " During this 2019 period, the implementation of the project is generally unsatisfactory. Only 37% physical activity completion rate was reported by the project team. The process of revising the logical framework and the Extended action plan of the project led to the late adoption of the work plan only in July 2019. Only 5 months were available for the implementation of this work plan 2019. Under intermediate result 1 related to the professionalisation of ASCE-LC control and anti-corruption missions, training has been carried out and equipment acquired. For most of the planned activities, the implementation processes have started but the activities are not completed by the end of the year. In terms of results, a few outputs can be indicated but not of developmental results induced by the few outputs recorded. For intermediate result 2 related to prevention of corrupt practices and similar offenses in public administrations, it can also be noted that the activities are in progress and the outputs are not fully completed. However, we noted the realisation of some awareness-raising and coordination actions without tangible impact in terms of results. The project is largely behind expectations, but we can highlight that the review of the results chain and the management structure which, from 2020, can bring greater clarity to the project process."
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
